bwwExcerpt: Actors are like shadows, going through the right motions but leaving no marks. If Bohmer’s Glinda finds a bunch of little places to add overexcited kicks and purrs, her singing either misfires or fizzles out. Samuels’ Elphaba can let rip a mighty belt, but she whiffs the role’s comedy, as if Elphaba were too one-dimensionally virtuous to do anything but be taken seriously. Karen D'Souza, Mercury News: Despite showing its age on stage, particularly in the draggy first act, “Wicked” still enchante
